Linux Distributions that look and feel like MacOS


10 July, 2020

The Linux community makes beautiful Linux distributions, for both the look and the feel, but Apple has some really brilliant people who are paid to make their designs and stuff, so they have undeniabely beautiful looks and the feel is just great to say the least,

No, I havent been sold to the corporate lords yet, my point is they have beautiful things and we want them.

So here are 3 linux distributions that look and feel a lot like MacOS, soo much so that that it will be difficult to tell any difference

Elementary OS

They developers at elementary say that they aren't copying MacOS' design but none-the-less, what they make feels a awfully lot like macOS

If you are looking for a light weight solution, this might work

BackLash Linux

Backlash linux is relatively new, but does an amazing job of imitating macOS, everything from icons to the center search thingy

Another wonderfull thing about Backlash is its based on Ubuntu, so all application/scripts that work on Ubuntu will (99% of the times) work on BackLash Linux.

Gmac Linux

This one is just ubuntu in macOS' clothes, like straight up no other difference under the hood.

It's good old GNOME heavily customised to look and feel like MacOS.

Totally recommended if you use Ubuntu already, 100% of everything you use on ubuntu will work on this.
